headline: World Cup Japan vs Croatia: Interest is so High in Japan a Streamer Can't Cope
summary: CyberAgent Inc.’s Abema TV may have to restrict access to Japan’s World Cup game at midnight Monday local time, as runaway demand is pushing the streaming service to its limits.

headline: Dow Jones Newswires: Chinese consumer-related stocks rally as COVID restrictions eased
summary: Chinese consumer-related shares from airlines to food chain operators are higher in early trade Monday, after Beijing pared back some of its strictest COVID-19 control measures, pointing to a reopening of the economy.

headline: Ghana Bonds: Ghana to Exchange Local Debt for New Bonds
summary: Ghana is asking local bondholders to accept losses on interest payments as it restructures its debt to qualify for a loan from the International Monetary Fund.

headline: Carlos Casanova on the Markets (Audio)
summary: Live market coverage co-anchored from Hong Kong and New York. Overnight on Wall Street is daytime in Asia. Markets never sleep, and neither does Bloomberg.

headline: : New Zealand plans law to force Google, Meta to pay news publishers for content
summary: New Zealand intends to require large tech companies like Google and Meta to compensate local media companies for content they use and share on their platforms.

headline: Dow Jones Newswires: China Caixin services PMI falls to 6-month low amid stifling COVID restrictions
summary: A private gauge of China's services sector slipped further into contraction in November, the lowest reading since May, reflecting continued downward pressures brought by the government's efforts to stamp out Covid-19 outbreaks.

headline: Traders Eye Leveraged Loans as Red Flags for Corporate Bonds in the US
summary: Leveraged loans seemed like a smart bet earlier this year, but they will become vulnerable in a recessionary environment.

headline: The Wall Street Journal: Saudi crown prince set to invest in Credit Suisse’s new investment bank
summary: Saudi Arabia’s crown prince and a U.S. private-equity firm run by Barclays PLC’s former chief executive are among investors preparing to invest $1 billion or more into Credit Suisse‘s new investment bank, people familiar with the matter said.

headline: Vietnam PM Orders Raising Loan Quotas for Some Banks, Firms - Bloomberg
summary: Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh directed the central bank and credit organizations to immediately raise loan limits for banks and to businesses in good health to boost economic growth, job creation and inflation control, the government website reported.

headline: World’s Biggest Party Revs Up Unstoppable Modi Campaign Machine
summary: On a recent Friday morning, Dhansukh Patel -- volunteer, loyal foot soldier and long-time member of India’s ruling Bharatiya Janata Party -- sat on the verandah of his home deep in discussion with aides on strategies to win more voters to the party.

headline: Oil Market Today: Latest News and Analysis for Dec 5
summary: Oil climbed after OPEC+ kept oil output steady, sanctions on Russian crude kicked in, and China made further progress toward reopening.

headline: Saudi Crown Prince to Invest in Credit Suisse Unit, WSJ Reports
summary: Saudi Arabia’s Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman is preparing to invest in Credit Suisse Group AG’s investment bank, the Wall Street Journal reported.

headline: Biden Hosts U2, Clooney in Reception for Kennedy Center Honorees

headline: It's Time to 'Go Back' Into China Stocks, Abrdn Asia CEO Says

headline: China Carmakers Are Ordering Their Own Ships to Get Export Ready
summary: Two of China’s biggest automakers are so determined to ensure their cars make it from factories on the mainland to anyone who wants to drive them they’ve bought their own ships.

headline: Hedge Fund Sees Webtoons as Next Wave of Korea Culture Investing
summary: Following the success of K-pop bands like BTS and dramas including “Squid Game,” one fund manager is betting that “webtoons” will be the next Korean cultural phenomenon to take the world by storm.

headline: SBF Says He Will Testify Before House, Without Committing to Date
summary: Sam Bankman-Fried says he will testify before the House Financial Services Committee after he’s finished “learning and reviewing” the events that led to the implosion of FTX.

headline: England Reaches World Cup Quarterfinals, Beats Senegal 3-0

headline: UK Rail Union Rejects Pay Offer, Christmas Strikes Still Planned

headline: Retirement Living: How I’m Staying in Shape by Turning My Daily Stroll Into Hard Exercise

headline: Michigan couple makes $9,000 a month teaching people to launch lucrative side hustles: Our No. 1 rule is 'anyone can do it'
summary: Jamie and Sarah McCauley started their YouTube channel, which teaches people how to start side hustles, in 2019. Now, it brings them up to $9,000 per month.

headline: US Knocked Out of World Cup, Loses to the Netherlands 3-1

summary: Hair-loss treatments represent a $3.9 billion industry, and hair loss has emerged as another long COVID symptom.

headline: China Covid Lockdown Protests Put Xi in Unfamiliar Territory

headline: El Salvador Deploys Thousands of Troops to Combat Gangs

headline: British Museum Reportedly in Talks on Parthenon Sculptures

summary: Moscow will intensify its cyber efforts to pressure the sources of Ukraine’s military and political support both domestic and foreign, according to Microsoft Corp.

summary: S&P Global Ratings economist Beth Ann Bovino, in a post-Thanksgiving weekend report on Monday, is forecasting a recession for the U.S. next year.

headline: Bill Hwang Seeks Dismissal of Charges For 'Deceitful' US Conduct
summary: Archegos Capital Management’s Bill Hwang asked a judge to toss out fraud charges against him because prosecutors allegedly engaged in “deceitful” conduct in the early days of the government’s probe.

headline: Turkey’s CHP Vows $100 Billion of Direct Investment If Elected
summary: Kemal Kilicdaroglu , the leader of Turkey’s main opposition party, promised to bring $100 billion of direct investment if elected to power in the elections scheduled for June next year.

summary: Just Stop Oil activists tucked themselves into a Harrods display bed as part of fuel poverty protests sweeping the UK.

summary: Iran started construction Saturday on a 300-megawatt nuclear power project in its southern oil-rich Khuzestan province.

summary: AT&T Inc. agreed to pay a $6.25 million penalty to settle an unusual lawsuit by federal regulators claiming its executives selectively disclosed nonpublic information about the company’s finances to Wall Street analysts.

headline: Don’t overlook this health warning on your holiday lights: 3 tips for decorating safely this season

headline: Want to make difficult conversations easier? Use this Bob Dylan-inspired phrase, says bestselling author Susan Cain
summary: Susan Cain, the bestselling author of "Quiet" and "Bittersweet," says you can make difficult conversations easier with a four-word lyric inspired by Bob Dylan.

headline: Northern Ireland Would Vote Against Unity, Irish Times Reports
summary: Northern Ireland would be decisively against a united Ireland if there was a vote on the issue, according to an Ipsos opinion poll for a new research project into North-South relations and The Irish Times.

summary: Oyo Hotels said it’s cutting 600 jobs in its corporate and technology departments, or about a sixth of its total workforce.

summary: The African Development Bank said it is providing $301 million to Uganda to help it upgrade the colonial-era meter-gauge rail linking its capital to the Kenyan border to help cut transport costs.

headline: Italy's Largest Refinery Won't Be Nationalized, Minister Says
summary: Italy’s largest refinery, which is owned by Russia’s Lukoil PJSC, is not destined for nationalization, according to Industry Minister Adolfo Urso.

headline: : ‘The Twitter files’ shows company’s internal debate on how to handle Hunter Biden laptop story
summary: Elon Musk turned to the former Rolling Stone journalist Matt Taibbi, to reveal how Twitter decided to limit access to the Hunter Biden laptop story during the 2020 election campaign.
